cooking_method:
1. In a large bowl, combine shrimp, olive oil, chili powder, cumin, smoked paprika, garlic powder, and cayenne pepper. 
2. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp and cook until pink, about 3-4 minutes per side. 
3. Warm the tortillas in the microwave or on a griddle. 
4. Assemble the tacos with the cooked shrimp, shredded cabbage, sliced avocado, and a squeeze of lime juice.

ingredients: Egg noodles or rice for serving
cooking_method:
1. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add onion and cook until softened. 
2. Add garlic and mushrooms and cook until mushrooms release their liquid. 
3. Add beef and cook until browned, about 5-7 minutes. 
4. Sprinkle flour over the beef mixture and stir until combined. 
5. Slowly pour in beef broth, stirring constantly. 
6. Bring to a simmer and cook until the sauce thickens, about 5 minutes. 
7. Remove from heat and stir in sour cream. 
8. Serve over egg noodles or rice.

1. Slice beef into thin strips. 
2. In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat. 
3. Add beef and cook until browned, about 5 minutes. 
4. Remove beef from skillet and set aside. 
5. Add onion and garlic to skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. 
6. Add mushrooms and cook until browned, about 5-7 minutes. 
7. Sprinkle flour over vegetables and stir until well combined. 
8. Slowly pour in beef broth, stirring constantly, and bring to a simmer. 
9. Add beef back to skillet and let simmer until sauce thickens, about 10 minutes. 
10. Stir in sour cream, mustard, and Worcestershire sauce. 
11. Season with salt and pepper. 
12. Serve hot over egg noodles or rice.
